sufian.video.server.pipe

Class VideoPipe

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.DatagramSocket
      • sufian.video.server.pipe.VideoPipe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    H263Pipe, H264Pipe

    public abstract class VideoPipe
extends DatagramSocket
implements Runnable
    Abstract class for redirecting RTP video packets from one port to another. Runs on a separate Thread. The subclass has to implement the abstract methods according to the specific protocol.
    Author:
    Sufian Latif

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Byte array to hold the packet's contents.
      private static boolean DEBUG

      private String destIP

      The port to receive the forwarded packets.
      protected boolean forwarding
      true if the packets are being forwarded.
      protected DatagramPacket packet
      The DatagramPacket to be forwarded.
      protected boolean playRequested
      true if the server has received a PLAY request from client.
      protected boolean ready
      true when all the necessary data are parsed from the stream.
      protected int rtphl
      Length of RTP packet header.
      private boolean running
      The thread is active while this is true.
      private int ssrc
      The SSRC (Synchronization Source Identifier) of the RTP stream.
      private static String TAG 
      private int tStamp
      The value of timestamp field of RTP packets.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VideoPipe

        public VideoPipe(int port)
          throws SocketException
        Creates a VideoPipe.
        Parameters:
        port - The port to receive and send RTP packets
        Throws:
        SocketException - if an error occurs while creating or binding the socket

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        protected abstract void parse()
        This method should parse the necessary data from the stream and set ready to true.

      • waitToForward

        protected abstract void waitToForward()
        This method should block packet forwarding if it is necessary to start forwarding with some special packet. When the special packet comes, this method should set forwarding to true.

      • setDestination

        public void setDestination(String ip,
                  int port)
        Sets the superclass DatagramSocket's destination IP address and port.
        Parameters:
        ip - Destination IP address
        port - Destination port number

      • startForwarding

        public void startForwarding()
        This method should be called by the RTSPServer when the client sends a PLAY request.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the thread.

      • getSSRC

        public int getSSRC()
        Returns:
        The SSRC field parsed from the stream.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        This method should be called by the RTSPServer to wait until the pipe is ready to forward.
        Returns:
        true if the pipe is ready to forward packets.

      • getSeq

        private int getSeq()
        For debugging purposes.
        Returns:
        Sequence number of last received packet

      • getMark

        private String getMark()
        For debugging purposes.
        Returns:
        The String "Mark" if the last received packet was marked

      • getType

        private int getType()
        For debugging purposes. Valid only for H264Pipe.
        Returns:
        The type of the NAL unit

      • getTStamp

        private int getTStamp()
        For debugging purposes.
        Returns:
        The timestamp of last received packet
